Package abalone.client

Class AbaloneClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • abalone.client.AbaloneClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientProtocol
    public class AbaloneClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientProtocol
    The Abalone Client, will be used by the client. Created on 17-01-2019.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sam Freriks and Ayla van der Wal.

      • AbaloneClient

        public AbaloneClient()
        Construct a AbaloneClient. create a new Tui and set the proper parameters.
        Ensures
        that the gamesize will be set to 0, that a new Tui will be created

      • AbaloneClient

        public AbaloneClient​(java.lang.String systemTest,
                     java.net.InetAddress ip,
                     int port,
                     boolean isAi,
                     int gamesize)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ServerUnavailableException
        a constructor of the AbaloneClient only used by the system test.
        Parameters:
        systemTest - name of the client
        ip - IP to connect to
        port - the wanted port
        isAi - to set the AI on and off
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception if IO is crashing
        ServerUnavailableException - exception is the serverconnection fails
        Ensures
        to set all the variables so the System test can run properly

        Parameters:

        Throws:

        Ensures

      • handleHandshake

        public void handleHandshake​(boolean chat,
                            boolean challenge,
                            boolean leaderboard,
                            java.lang.String playerName)
                     throws ServerUnavailableException,
                            ExitProgram
        Description copied from interface: ClientProtocol
        When a client first connects to the server, it sends a hello message, which. includes some information about itself and the player: HELLO + DELIMITER + supports chat + DELIMITER + supports challenge + DELIMITER + supports leaderboard + DELIMITER + player name + EOC
        Specified by:
        handleHandshake in interface ClientProtocol
        Throws:
        ExitProgram - when the programming is going to exit
        ServerUnavailableException

      • joinQueue

        public void joinQueue​(int gamesize)
               throws ServerUnavailableException,
                      ExitProgram
        Description copied from interface: ClientProtocol
        After the handshake, clients should join one of three queues, either for 2, 3. or 4-player games: JOIN + DELIMITER + + EOC
        Specified by:
        joinQueue in interface ClientProtocol
        Parameters:
        gamesize - What kind of game to join, either a 2, 3 or 4-player game
        Throws:
        ExitProgram - When IO exception
        ServerUnavailableException

      • sendMove

        public void sendMove​(java.lang.String playerName,
                     java.lang.String direction,
                     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> marbleIndices)
              throws ServerUnavailableException
        Description copied from interface: ClientProtocol
        When the client has come up with a move, it sends it to the server: MOVE + DELIMITER + player name + DELIMITER + direction + DELIMITER + index of field (multiple times) + EOC All marbles involved in the move should be included, each separated by DELIMITER.
        Specified by:
        sendMove in interface ClientProtocol
        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player that made this move
        direction - The direction that the line of marbles should move to.
        marbleIndices - All indices of the marbles involved in this move. The order of the indices does not matter.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException

      • getCurrentQueueSizes

        public void getCurrentQueueSizes()
                          throws ServerUnavailableException
        Description copied from interface: ClientProtocol
        The client can always query the server for the current queue sizes, no matter. its current state: QUEUE_SIZE + EOC
        Specified by:
        getCurrentQueueSizes in interface ClientProtocol
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException

      • sendExit

        public void sendExit()
              throws ServerUnavailableException
        Description copied from interface: ClientProtocol
        When a client wants to exit, it should inform the server:. EXIT + EOC
        Specified by:
        sendExit in interface ClientProtocol
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException
